problem: Solve for $x$, where $x>0$ and $5x^2+9x-18=0$. Express your answer as a simplified common fraction.
chatgpt_solution:
Since the quadratic is not easily factorable, we use the quadratic formula: $$x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}.$$ In this case, we have $a=5$, $b=9$, and $c=-18$, so \begin{align*}
x &=\frac{-9\pm\sqrt{9^2-4(5)(-18)}}{2(5)}\\
&=\frac{-9\pm\sqrt{81+360}}{10}\\
&=\frac{-9\pm\sqrt{441}}{10}\\
&=\frac{-9\pm 21}{10}.
\end{align*}We have $x=\frac{-9+21}{10}=\frac{12}{10}=\boxed{\frac{6}{5}}$ or $x=\frac{-9-21}{10}=\frac{-30}{10}=-3$.  Since $x>0$, we discard the solution $x=-3$.
